text: the new iPad pro is the most powerful
and largest device in Apple's iPad
lineup and the company's CEO Tim Cook
says it can replace your laptop but I'm
not convinced at the end of the day the
iPad pro is just a big iPad and I don't
think it can really replace your laptop
here's why the iPad pro has a 12 point 9
inch screen which is just around the
size as the MacBook Air but here's the
thing the iPad pro runs iOS which is
incompatible with desktop programs and
developers have been slow to make
innovative apps for the iPad there's
little indication they'll gravitate
towards iPad pro just because it has a
bigger screen and a keyboard the iPad
pro will continue to function as just a
large iPad until developers figure a way
to push that big screen past casual
consumption apps like streaming video
sure some apps some great companies like
Adobe Microsoft and 53 will have apps
ready to go for the iPad pro at launch
but I'm not convinced they'll be enough
to get someone to spend 980 bucks on an
iPad pro and keyboard instead of a $900
MacBook Air the keyboard cover feels
unfinished and it's difficult to type on
but nothing what I've seen about the
iPad pro makes me believe it's a
replacement for the laptop it's really
just a big iPad
